trends: There have been 74 other sightings in St Louis
There were no other sightings in St Louis on or around June 20th 2012
divs: sighting detailsi was outside having a smoke, walking around some, when i turned around towards the west and immediately noticed a "classic" triangle flying in a normal commercial route to the st. louis airport over south st. louis (when the flights are landing from the west to east). it was initially the relative size of a golf ball at a 45 degree angle, southwest, in the clear sky. it was clearly an isosceles triangle of white lights, but all looked perfectly round and none were blinking. there was a red blinking light in the middle of the triangle. it made no discernible sound, even when there as there little ambient traffic noise when i can normally can hear a commercial plane as well as see it taking that route. after observing the lights\object for about 5 seconds, the front light shut off! i see many planes who's front landing lights slowly become less visible as it passes by my house getting closer to the airport, but this front light definitely shut off. i could not see a structure, only lights, that appeared to be on a flying craft changing orientation as it was flying by. the normal commercial route is straight as they are flying as they pass my house until i can't see them through trees to the west anymore. tonight the craft banked left as it neared the point i usually can't see the planes continue in their straight course. the "roundness" and size of the white lights, the front light shutting off (while approaching an airport for a landing!), then veering away from the airport all prompted me to make this report of an unidentified flying object, but yet i would "identify" it as a "triangle ufo". i did not notice any other commercial planes on that route this evening.
Summary: Triangle flies commercial route over south St. Louis towards airport then veers away
